newsitem.title: UK: Uk's FTSE 100 drops 50 points after Dow decline.
newsitem.headline: Uk's FTSE 100 drops 50 points after Dow decline.

text.p: The UK's FTSE 100 index of blue-chip stocks fell over one percent in early trade on Monday as Friday's decline on Wall Street sparked a bout of profit-taking after recent market gains.
The FTSE 100 was down 54.1 points, or 1.1 percent, at 4,823.1 by 0752 GMT, with decliners in a majority of some five-to-one.

Banks and drug stocks, which helped propel the market's recent strong gains, led the retreat with HSBC Holdings Plc down 16-1/2p at 20.73-1/2 stg, Barclays Plc down 23p at 12.60 and SmithKline Beecham Plc down 23-1/2p at 11.75 stg.
British Telecom was another major casualty, down 13p at 417 amid continuing worries over its planned tie-up with MCI after the U.S. group issued a surprise profit warning earlier this month.
The Dow on Friday closed 130 points or 1.6 percent lower after being down some 93 points as the London market closed.
